channel.title: Music on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant
channel.description: Recent content in Music on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant

item.title: Just Updated - iTunes in the Cloud (beta)
item.description: There's a new update to iTunes this morning (evening in the UK) - iTunes 10.

item.title: Are you thinking what I'm thinking? Two predictions for Steve Jobs?
item.description: Are you thinking what I'm thinking? It's only a few hours til the start of the Apple WWDC which is ‘the biggest’ event in the year for Apple Fans.

item.title: [Interactive] Dangermouse wants you to ro.me - another great HTML5 music video
item.description: Music artist and producer Dangermouse has done it again - or that's to say Google has done it with HTML5.

item.title: Group Review: Manage your CD library collection on a Mac
item.description: Now that you’ve ripped and digitised all of your CD library – what do you do with your CD’s?

item.title: Comparison of Digital Music Retailers in Europe
item.description: Comment: There are a number of digital music retailers working around Europe, here is Damien Saunders’ summary of a few of the bigger services (catalogue greater than 1 million tracks).

item.title: Aging music lovers what happens when we are 80?
item.description: In a few years time, many of us will want to retire - what's going to happen to us and our communities we live in if suddenly todays 20 and 30 somethings are 80?

item.title: Datz makes downloading unlimited DRM free music hard
item.description: Comment: Datz music lounge has come out for Xmas in the UK with a £99.

item.title: Sony Ericsson does chunky retro Walkman W902
item.description: Ive had a look at the Sony Ericsson new Walkman W902 with retro chunky buttons much like a those on a casette walkman.

item.title: Ill move to Linux thanks Amarok
item.description: Damien says, one of the biggest problems with Linux has always been a lack of strength in its media players.

item.title: Music file sharing on the up and up
item.description: Damien Saunders says -research shows continued growth in file-sharing and downloading of mp3s is now common place.

item.title: Apple to standardise iTunes prices in Europe
item.description: comment: The reason that Apple charges different retail prices in each market is due to the differences in wholesale prices charged in each market by the major labels.
